taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [For Giovanni Valentino Mattia Fabbroni, 1752 – 1822, Italian naturalist]

bio:treatment.description: Stems prostrate. Leaves loosely appressed when dry, spreading when moist. Capsule ovoid to pyriform, [0.3–]0.5–0.8[–1] mm.
bio:treatment.discussion: Fabronia is characterized by its very small size, ovate to oblong-lanceolate, long-acuminate, usually toothed leaves tipped with linear cells, rhomboidal laminal cells, and relatively short costa. However, because of the wide degree of morphological variability, especially within the F. ciliaris complex, Fabronia is taxonomically difficult. Discussions of Fabronia by H. A. Crum and L. E. Anderson (1981) and W. R. Buck (1994b) are enlightening with respect to taxonomic problems.

key_statement.description: Leaf apices acute or acuminate; margins dentate or sometimes entire, not ciliate, teeth of 1 cell
Leaf apices acute to long-acuminate; margins ciliate-dentate, teeth often of more than 1 cell
